abstract: The autonomous vehicles developed by Google pose enormous challenges for the world of law and insurance, speakers at a symposium said.
snippet: The autonomous vehicles developed by Google pose enormous challenges for the world of law and insurance, speakers at a symposium said.
lead_paragraph: SANTA CLARA, Calif. — Even as Google tests its small fleet of self-driving vehicles on California highways, legal scholars and government officials are warning that society has only begun wrestling with the changes that would be required in a system created a century ago to meet the challenge of horseless carriages.

headline.main: Collision in the Making Between Self-Driving Cars and How the World Works
headline.print_headline: Collision in the Making Between Self-Driving Cars and How the World Works
